alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Franklin; Huntingdon; Juniata; Perry (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 5:17PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN HUNTINGDON... CENTRAL FRANKLIN...SOUTHWESTERN JUNIATA...SOUTHWESTERN PERRY AND WEST CENTRAL CUMBERLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 517 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles northwest of Shippensburg, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Chambersburg, Guilford, St. Thomas, Fayetteville, Scotland, Fort Loudon, Roxbury, Big Spring State Park, Doylesburg, Upper Strasburg, Willow Hill, Fannettsburg and Orrstown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
